meanings.definition: The point where two converging lines meet.
meanings.sent1: I stood at the corner where the walls met.
meanings.sent2: The cat sat in the corner of the room.
meanings.sent3: The spider built its web in the corner of the ceiling.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes met mine at the corner of the street.
meanings.sent5: The treasure was hidden in the corner of the old map.

meanings.definition: A small, secluded, or remote area.
meanings.sent1: The garden had a quiet corner where I liked to read.
meanings.sent2: She found a cozy corner in the library to study.
meanings.sent3: The little mouse nibbled on cheese in the corner of the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The cabin was nestled in a corner of the forest.
meanings.sent5: The cafe had a charming corner with a view of the park.

meanings.definition: To force (a person or animal) into a position from which they cannot escape.
meanings.sent1: The cat tried to corner the mouse in the pantry.
meanings.sent2: The police managed to corner the suspect in the alley.
meanings.sent3: The kids tried to corner their friend in a game of tag.
meanings.sent4: The hikers were cornered by a bear in the woods.
meanings.sent5: The chess player strategically cornered their opponent's king.
